intro: Horkelia cuneata var. typica, commonly known as the Sierra primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine meadows. Horkelia cuneata var. typica is adapted to cold climates and is an important part of the local flora in its native range.
